column4: i have a computer that intermitantly boots, what would you say is the problem?
bad power supply
i just right swaped that 5 minuts ago
was it doing that before you replaced power supply?
i have a feeling the computer is possibly not grounded properly
yes that would do it
i waited till i had the problem. powered computer, pc froze in the middle of boot, rebooted, and problem occoured
before i take out the board and test the computer outside, would you recommend anything else?
most likely culprits are power supply and possibly memory
there is a channel    #hardware   they may know
ill try it out
good luck
thanx
the channel is actually   ##hardware
#hardware is dead, but as im taking out the boared, i notice that the heatsink is very hot!
yes overheating will definitely cause that.especially if unplugging it for 15 minues helps
are all fans working
all 3 of them
do u have any idea what dualcore temperature should be running at?
no sorry id don't.  maybe google                 dual core normal temperature
i have a feeling it is temperature now! :-)
yes i think so too. especially since you mentioned that a 15 minute cooling period helps
especially with dual core
